source: Words in Swedenborg by Rev. Frank Rose

definitions: from which; from something as an origin
(sometimes used in the sense of sexual potency)
set free from guilt or responsibility
apart from any specific example or reality
something added; additional but not essential
good quality added by man but not essential
bring forward; offer as an example
allow something or someone to enter (not used to mean "confess" or "own up")
mental awareness; noticing; observation; consciousness (formerly transl. |animadvertence|)
inmost part of the temple which only the priest could enter; shrine; holiest place
love; emotion; feeling; motivation; inclination; interest; being affected by something
affection for good; love of good
affection for truth; love of truth
love of usefulness; love of useful activities
relationship by marriage or other connection (compare |consanguinity| = blood relationship)
death struggle (the agony of the last moments of physical life)
aliveness; eagerness; being quick to respond
food of the gods (|nectar| = drink of the gods)
curse given by a church or religion
religion of the people of ancient times, represented by Noah and his descendants
people who lived in ancient times; ancient Greek philosophers (also translated |antiquities|)

person in heaven (note: in Swedenborg's Writings all angels are people who have lived in the natural world and entered heaven after death. In the early part of the |arcana coelestia| "angels" refer to angels of the highest heaven only. In later works "angels" are inhabitants of any heaven)

good person in the World of Spirits, which is between heaven and hell (note: in the early part of the |arcana coelestia| an "angelic spirit" refers to an angel of the Second Heaven. Later in the same work it refers to an angel of the First Heaven, and after that to a good person in the World of Spirits)
purer kind of blood involving the nervous system; medium through which electrical impulses travel
lower level of the mind; temperament; personality
someone living before the flood of Noah
religion that existed just before the flood of Noah
love couples have for each other before their wedding
places on the opposite side of the earth
people who live on the other side of the world
being raised to Divine or angelic status
understanding; having some grasp of (not used to mean "anxiety")
person with a knowledge of secrets (or arcana)
believer in Arius (who denied the Divinity of Christ)
claim; take to oneself without right
as if of oneself; seemingly on one's own
(an unknown precious stone, L. _|astroites|_ also trans. "star-stone")
the atmosphere through which magnetism passes (compare: |ether| = the atmosphere through which light passes)
(a stage in the change from caterpillar to butterfly)
legendary reptile like a lizard, dragon or serpent
large land animal (compare |leviathan| = large sea animal ï¿½ Job 40:15, 41:1)
stretcher for carrying a corpse; coffin
bitter fluid secreted by the liver
external covering of the spirit; border between the spiritual and natural (also transl. |limbus| and |cutaneous envelope|)
grind; thresh; crush with a mortar and pestle
wingless locust (may also be used to mean the locust larva)
magnifying glass used to start fires (also called |sun glass|)
official document from the Pope |callosity| = hardening of the skin; callous; callousness
slander; speak maliciously against; verbally attack
clergyman; member of a religious order
covered with decorative harness (used of horses)
criticism; scrutiny; picking at every detail
book of religious instruction with questions and answers, based on the Ten Commandments
supremely heavenly; having a quality of goodness and love (the quality of loving the Lord)
having to do with the sky
Most Ancient Church (the religion represented by Adam and Eve)
heavenly kingdom (more or less equal to the |celestial heaven| also used of the |celestial church|)
heavenly love; love to the Lord
heavenly person; person whose life is ruled by love to the Lord
heavenly natural; heavenly qualities on the natural level (also called |the celestial of the natural|, |the celestial in the natural| and |natural good|)
heavenly qualities on the spiritual level
good qualities that come from living according to true beliefs from love
heavenly rational; heavenly qualities on the rational level (also called |the celestial of the rational|)
heavenly sense; the meaning of the Word as understood in the highest heaven (also called the |inmost sense|)
belief and wisdom that come from love
heavenly truth; truth as it is with the celestial angels; truth made living from love
mythological three-headed dog-like monster that guarded the gates of the underworld
smaller brain at the back of the head
larger brain at the front of the head
garland; wreath of flowers worn on the head

charity.theological_term: Swedenborg's doctrinal term: love of the neighbor

definitions: mythological whirlpool opposite the rock |scylla|; |between scylla and charybdis| = between two dangerous alternatives
having a pure and clean attitude toward sex (whether married or not)
chaste.theological_term: Swedenborg's specific meaning about conjugial love

definitions: purity of attitude toward sex (applied especially to married people, not used to mean "celibacy")
delusion; hallucination (from a mythological, fire-breathing monster)
digested food in liquid form which passes through the lining of the intestines
gray matter in the brain containing the neurons
tree in the citrus family like a lemon but larger
person who lives by civil laws and customs
conditions of emotional coldness between married partners
goodness that is not genuine but is related to what is genuine
part of the brain where all of the senses come together and are experienced
completion; something that fills up or makes complete
whole made up of many connected parts
living with a mistress or concubine
ardent desire (usually evil); any abnormally strong desire
unite; join together in a common cause
essential marriage principle; 2. positive attitude toward marriage; 3. marriage of good and truth
belonging to marriage and the love married partners have for each other; matrimonial
coldness toward marriage and toward the marriage partner
bond like that of marriage between what is true and what is good
putting on the appearance of love in the marriage
sphere proceeding from God inspiring humans to marry, and animals to mate
the Christian ideal of married love and monogamy
love married partners have for each other
love of marriage (usually used of the spiritual bonds in a monogamous marriage)
with a positive attitude to marriage
marriage between what is good and what is true
relating to marriage (usually in a negative sense, or concerning merely external marriages)
unholy linking of evil and falsity
following as a result; in keeping with; coming after
finish completely; bring to an end
close or end of the age (in the King James Bible = "End of the world")
in a connected sequence; in a series
gradations as from dark to light, cold to warm (also called |degrees of breadth|)
truths connected back to their source
being opposite; contrary (|contrariety| = differences that clash; |variety| = differences that harmonize)
anxious and sad because of human sin
penitence; anxiety because of human sin
deduction; idea that follows as a conclusion
flourish used by printers to indicate the end of a book or chapter
bodily part; part of the mind attached to the body
bodily; physical (including gestures, actions, looks, words, sensations and physical pleasures)
loving things for the sake of self and domination
person who Loves self and bodily pleasure and not heavenly things
physical and worldly part of a person
match; agree; be analogous to; be equal to (in Swedenborg's Writings this word is used of the relationship between things on two different levels of reality; usually the spiritual and the physical)
physical equivalent (something on the physical plane that is caused by something spiritual)
belonging to the cortex or gray matter of the brain
strong desire; lust; greed; selfish want
assistant pastor; one who has the "care" of souls
related to the skin; like skin
external covering of the spirit; the border between the spiritual and the natural (also transl. |border| and |limbus|)
skin (including the skins covering the internal organs of the body)
pour liquid into another container without stirring up sediment
distinct levels, one higher than the other (also called |discrete degrees| and |degrees of height|)
gradations as from dark to light, hot to cold (also called |continuous degrees| and |degrees of latitude|)
act of robbery, plundering and preying upon
person in the lowest hell (note: in Swedenborg's Writings all devils are people who have lived in the natural world and entered hell after death)
hell acting as if it were one person; the personification of evil
many devils working together to do evil
crown worn by a king or a queen
understanding; the ability to understand (usually transl. |the understanding|)
distinct levels, one higher than the other (also called |degrees of altitude| and |degrees of height|)
the lower level of the mind
pretend; put on a false appearance
fake; person who pretends and counterfeits
clearly set apart; able to be thought of separately; distinguishably
The Divine Being from which all things exist
heavenly quality of God; God's love flowing into the celestial heaven
Jesus as God in human form; the human nature of Jesus glorified, or made Divine; Divine Humanity
God as He is in Himself
heaven in the human form as the body of God (also called the |grand man|)
natural or lowest level of the mind of Jesus glorified or made Divine
the way God operates and acts
qualities of God proceeding from Him
the way God governs the universe
rational level of the mind of Jesus glorified or made Divine
truth of God; truth as received in the spiritual heaven
God's truth as it is in Him, and as it flows from Him into angels and into people
teachings; particular points of doctrine; doctrinal tenets
religious teaching; religious principle or point of view (for the. most part used in the singular)
true perspective on the teachings of Scripture; correct point of view
belonging to a household, home or relationship in the home
good qualities a person is born with (also called |domestic natural good| and |natural good|)
love of ruling over others (also called |the love of dominating| and |the love of ruling|)
evil spirit associated with the Dragon (Rev. 12:3), symbol of the doctrine of salvation by faith alone (also called |draconic spirit|)
waste removed as scum from liquid or molten metal
priest; minister; member of a religious order
structure or order of command in a church
selfish love of priests or ministers (also transl. the |ecclesiastic|'S |love of self|)
upbringing or raising of children (at home or in school)
conceited; lofty; with an inflated idea of self
chosen people; people who are saved
predestination; being chosen by God for heaven without regard to a person's quality
messenger; spirit sent out as a messenger (also called a |subject spirit|)
try to equal; compete; resemble; imitate
organ for emptying or getting rid of wastes (for example, when a person blows his nose he is using it as an emunctory)
figment of the mind; something existing only in the mind
fanatical person; someone who claims to be "filled with God"
fanatical person in the spiritual world; spirit who claims to be "filled with God"
garment without sleeves put on top of other clothes
being; reality; essential quality (from the Latin meaning "to be")
the atmosphere or medium through which light travels in space (also called the |ethereal atmosphere|)
not material; pertaining to the ether
person giving the talk or eulogy at a funeral (also called |panegyrist|)
evil that comes from false beliefs (also called |evil from falsity|)
evil in a person and in his life
from what is later or lower
from earlier things; from what is higher
excretory; for the elimination of waste
emptying out of the spirit; desolation
standing forth; coming into existence; presence; taking form
somewhat external part of a person
people who are mostly involved in external church activities
good actions; superficial acts of goodness
worship services, rituals and other activities
outward or literal meaning of Scripture
banish; wipe out; pull up by the roots
process of squeezing liquid out of a container into the surrounding area, as when blood is forced out of blood vessels into the surrounding tissue
cast-off skins or coverings (as when an animal molts)
belief; conviction about what is true
faith.theological_term: Swedenborg's doctrinal distinction faith vs charity

definitions: misleading physical appearances (i.e. that the sun rises and sets)
false idea or distortion of truth caused by an evil desire (also called |falsity from evil|)
portion of a book ready for binding
phosphorescent light; unreal or deceptive light (also called |ignis fatuus|)
deceptively; fictitiously; in a fake manner
savage; beastly; like a wild animal
fare paid to ride a ferry
strips of cloth on a headdress with jewels attached
Bishop with a headdress or miter (also transl. |mitred primate|)
beginnings; first things; things nearest to God (also transl. |primes|; )
lowest of the three heavens (also called |natural heaven| and |ultimate heaven|)
publicly stated doctrine (which may not agree with privately held beliefs, also transl. |outside doctrine|)
love of having sexual intercourse with another unmarried person
avenging spirits; three mythological goddesses of revenge
love belonging to your own "genius" or nature; love one has by nature; love present in one's own disposition
evil spirits of the worst kind
genii.archaic_usage: Latin plural + Swedenborg's evil spirit meaning
genii.theological_term: Latin plural + Swedenborg's evil spirit meaning

definitions: disposition; quality of a person; character
talent, inclination, quality or spirit of a people or nation
heathen; person outside of the church (in the Old Testament a non-Jew; from the Christian point of view a non-Christian)
(sometimes used in the expression |it is given| meaning "it exists" or "it is permitted")
piece of land; part of a field; marsh
making glorious; being exalted to glory (the process by which Jesus became Divine)
goodness that comes from living your beliefs
the good of doing things for others from love
the goodness of loving others more than oneself
good qualities people acquire from living according to their beliefs (also called |good in the natural|)
goodness that comes from following the truth; the goodness of loving the neighbor based on the truth (also called |spiritual good|)
the form of the entire heavens as the body of the Lord; _2._ the Lord's entire kingdom including heaven and the church on earth; _3._ The Lord (also called |the greatest man|)
area once overridden by the Tartars, including China, Mongolia, Tibet and parts of Russia (the Eastern and larger portion of |tartary|)
greatest things; things on the largest possible scale
the physical body as being crude and heavy when compared to the spiritual body
school or gathering in the spiritual world to discuss ideas and exercise the mind
conceit; pride (also transl. |elation| and |elation of mind|)
heavenly marriage; the marriage within a person between beliefs and loves (also called |the heavenly marriage| and |the marriage of good and truth|)
marriage within a person between beliefs and loves (also called |the heavenly conjugial| and |the marriage of good and truth|)
heavenly feeling of self given to those who are willing to be led by the Lord
meaning of the Word as understood by the highest angels (also called |the celestial sense|)
hill in the spiritual world next to the lower hill called |parnassum|
inherited evil; inborn tendencies toward evil
mixed; made up of a variety of different things
faith based only on tradition; faith based on the beliefs of others
similar in nature; of the same kind throughout
mixture made up of similar things
honorableness; integrity; respectability (not used to mean "truthfulness")
human nature with Divine qualities (God as appearing through angels is called the |human divine|)
the color of a hyacinth flower
the underlying union between the Divine and the Human aspects in Christ
the Word as the Son of God in His underlying relationship with the Father
unreal; imaginary; existing only as an idea
one who believes that nothing really exists except our own thoughts and ideas
in an imaginary _way;_ in thought but not in reality
phosphorescent light; unreal or deceptive light; _2._ the flame of marsh gas (also transl. |fatuous light|)
ordinary; of inferior quality; not noble
howling animal or bird (Isaiah _13:22_ transl. "wild beasts of the Islands" or "hyenas")
make clear; shed light on; enlighten
drink; take in; be deeply impressed
absorb; impress with; stain deeply; soak up
ideas formed from principles, or from inner experiences (compare: |material ideas| = ideas arising out of experience with physical things)
direct; without anything coming between (not used to mean "right now")
mercy given directly or without cause
revelation given directly to the individual
giving of credit or blame; making account
(used in the ordinary way, and also in the sense of "in a condition or state" as "in good" meaning "in a state of goodness")
introduce (especially by means of a ceremony); ordain
in the flesh; in a body
taking on a body of flesh
vague idea, not focused on a person or object
transfer of good qualities from one person to another
baby; child up to the age of five years
lower; on a lower level (not necessarily "worse")
devils working together as a crew
unbelief; faithlessness (not used to mean "marital infidelity")
the human nature Jesus inherited from Mary with its weaknesses
below; under; on a lower level
someone who believes that God decided after creation who would go to heaven and who to hell (compare |supra-lapsarian|)
deepest meaning of the Word (also called |the supreme sense|)
willingness to be led by the Lord
innocence.theological_term: Swedenborg's doctrinal term: willingness to be led by Lord

definitions: introduce as new; renew; renovate; fundamentally alter what has been established
fundamental alteration of what has been established
someone who fundamentally alters what has been established
insert; inject; put in; work into
covering; skin (including skins covering the internal organs of the body)
understanding; ability to understand; power of discernment
the intellectual part of a person; the understanding (usually transl. |the understanding|)
truth deeply understood; spiritual insight; higher wisdom
with understanding; in a way that is understood
will; ability to love, desire and intend (usually transl. |will|)
interaction and relationship between soul and body
deeper levels of a person's mind
the reasoning part of a person
someone or something that comes in between
soul; inner reaches of the mind
the human soul; the inmost part of a person
church in the hearts of people
deeper or spiritual aspect of marriage
inner meaning of Scripture as it applies to the history of different churches (also called the |proximate sense|)
spiritual part of a person; soul; deepest part
people who live by internal principles
inner aspect of the natural mind
spiritual meaning of Scripture (also called the |spiritual sense|)
in the spaces or intervals between things
inward; deeply felt; on a "gut" level
making right; making just; God's act of proclaiming the faithful to be just (not used to mean "excuse")
justification.theological_term: Theological term about God making just

definitions: knowledges as facts are called |knowledges|, |scientifics|, and |memory-knowledges|
knowledges as concepts, or ideas about internal things are called |knowledges| or |cognitions|
last things in a sequence; the most external things,
(adj.) honored; crowned with a Laurel Wreath
vegetables (especially ones with edible seeds in pods, also transl. |pulse| and |vegetables|)
nine-headed serpent in Greek mythology that lived in the marsh at Lerna
words and literal meaning of Scriptures (also referred to as |the letter|; |the sense of the letter| and |the literal sense|)
large sea animal (compare |behemoth| = large land animal - Job 40:15, 41:1)
border; envelope; external covering of the spirit; the border between the spiritual and natural; (also called |the cutaneous envelope of the spirit|; usually transl. |border| or |envelope|)
literal meaning of Scriptures (also referred to as |the letter of the word|; |the letter| and |the sense of the letter|)
title used of |the lord jesus christ|; God in Human Form
selfishness; loving self alone and not others except for selfish advantage
worldliness; loving material things more than heaven
region of the Spiritual World, below the World of Spirits and above hell
study; thoughtful essay; portion of a book
light (sometimes used of physical light or deceptive light)
source of light (the Sun and Moon are called |luminaries|)
light (sometimes used of a more spiritual or purer kind of light in contrast to |lumen|)
school (Aristotle's school in ancient Greece for youths)
soften by soaking in a liquid
the world on the largest scale; the universe (in contrast to the |microcosm| = miniature world; the world within an individual)
aspect of an individual (for example: |the internal man| = the internal part of a person)
the love married people have for each other (usually transl. |conjugial love| sometimes |marital love|; for many examples see under |conjugial|)
bond between good qualities, and true beliefs (also called |the heavenly conjugial| and |the heavenly marriage|)
ideas arising out of experience with material or physical things (compare: |immaterial ideas| = ideas formed from principles, or from inner experiences)
rock from which a precious stone is taken
large building constructed as a tomb
offering of cakes made with flour and other ingredients (also transl. |meal offering|)
indirect; by means of something else
indirect good; goodness that is not genuine but is allied to what is genuine and is useful
indirect inflowing; flowing in by means of something else
indirectly; by means of a go between
stories; accounts of experiences (also transl. |memorable relations| and |memorable occurrences|)
knowledges; data; facts (especially those derived from experience; also transl. |scientifics|)
mind (especially the higher levels of the mind, in contrast to |animus| which refers to the lower levels of the mind)
pure; unmixed; undiluted |consisting of mere correspondences| (or |pure|
consisting entirely of things that correspond; purely correspondential
looking for a reward of money or merit; merit seeking
other phenomena in the sky (such as clouds, wind; etc.)
human being as a miniature universe
human being as a miniature heaven
spirit; mind (including all levels of love, feeling, thought, memory, etc.)
headdress worn by a priest or a king
Bishop with a headdress (also transl. |filleted primate|)
ability to move the body (also transl. |motor life|; in contrast to the |sensitive life| or the ability to experience sensations)
love and friendship between people; caring more about others than about oneself
belonging to nature; worldly; earthly; (used mostly in contrast with "spiritual" rather than in contrast with "artificial")
lowest level of the spiritual world
lowest level of the human mind
goodness people are born with or acquire because of a good temperament (compare |good of the natural| = good qualities people on earth acquire by living according to true religious beliefs)
lowest of the three heavens (also called |the lowest heaven|; |first heaven|; |ultimate heaven|)
lowest of the three kingdoms of heaven
lowest level of the human mind; person whose interests are mainly on that level
theology that comes from the study of nature (in contrast with theology that is based on revelation)
scientific truth; knowledges on the natural level of the mind
this world (as opposed to the |spiritual world|)
belief in nature (instead of in God)
someone who believes in nature instead, of in God
drink of the gods (|ambrosia| = food of the gods)
wrath; revenge (from the Greek goddess of vengeance)
reeking; bad smelling; smelling like burnt flesh
newcomer to heaven; newly arrived angel
newcomer to the spiritual world; someone who has recently died
related to weddings or to being married
stage in the process of change from caterpillar to butterfly
favorable moment to do something evil
a philosophic term that expresses the idea that spiritual things flow into natural ones and not the other way around, also called |spiritual influx| and |opportune inflow|
region at the back of the head
howling creatures (possibly screech owls, Isaiah 13:21, transl. "doleful creature" King James Bible)
favorable opportunity; first sign that the individual is ready for marriage
omen.archaic_usage: 18th-century standard usage; less common in modern English

definitions: silk the color of an opal; iridescent silk
highly polished cylinder used to reflect a picture that has been drawn in such a way that it looks distorted on the flat page. The picture looks right when its reflection is seen on the cylinder
bony; made of bone; like a bone

the self; living from and for self; that which comes from self; selfhood; the feeling of self (usually transl. |proprium|; also transl. |selfhood|; and |self-image|) see under |proprium| for various combinations
octagonal building in the spiritual world
person who writes a eulogy in praise of someone who has died (also called a |eulogizer|)
park; garden (like the garden of Eden); beautiful landscape
heaven with beautiful flower gardens and parks
hill in the spiritual world (near the higher hill |helicon|)
someone living on Parnassus or Parnassium
something acted on (compare |agent| = something that acts on something else)
head or chief of a tribe (Abraham, Isaac and Jacob were "Patriarchs")
individual; unique; belonging to; special to
things allowed or permitted but not necessarily desired by God
conviction; system of religious belief (mostly used of false beliefs)
convictions; opinions; things one is persuaded to believe whether true or false
air pollution; toxic substances that have accumulated
imaginary mental image; vision; apparition (also called a |phantom|)
physical inflow (from the physical plane to the spiritual plane)
bed that a polygamist uses (a man with more than one wife)
Roman Catholic church (also called the |papal religion|)
person who lived after the flood
later condition or state (in contrast to |prior state|)
somewhere or other (used together with the Latin word _|ubi|_ to mean "some undefined place")
rush into; act quickly; plunge into
affirmed as a quality of something
superior wisdom; greater wisdom than others
person high in the church hierarchy, such as a bishop or archbishop
soon after; after a slight delay
lecherous male (from the Greek god of male fertility)
first things; things nearest to God
beginnings; first principles; the very first forms
Christian Church in its earliest state (also called |the church of the gentiles|)
birthright; priority of the first born
coming earlier in time or essence (in contrast to |posterior|)
former state; earlier condition; original state
members of the King's cabinet; King's advisers
desecrate; defile; mix the holy with the unholy
desecration; mixing the holy with the unholy
atone; improve; seek to win favor
mercy seat in the Tabernacle of Israel (a means of reconciliation between God and man, Exodus _25:17)_
belonging to self; what is one's own
what is one's own; self; living from and for self; selfhood; the feeling of self (also transl. |own|, |selfhood| and |self-image|)
feeling of self which the angels have
heavenly feeling of self that those have who are willing to be led by the Lord (also transl. |heavenly proprium| and |heavenly own|)
feeling of self that the devils have
sense of self which Jesus had, and which He made divine
feeling of self that humans have
hellish feeling of self that devils have
conceit; the sense that our intelligence is our own
sense of self that acknowledges that all that is good is from God
sense of self that is made alive in the process of regeneration
self-will; sense that one's loves and desires are one's own
lie face down on the ground (for prayer)
confirm; illustrate (not in the sense of "logically convince")
somewhat deeper meaning of the words very near to the literal meaning; implied meaning
inner meaning of Scripture as it applies to the history of churches (also called |the internal historical sense|)
ways in which things are close to each other
somewhere or other (used together with the Latin word |ubi| to mean "some undefined place")
vegetables (especially ones with edible seeds in pods, also transl. |legumes| and |vegetables|)
related to a spirit medium or oracle
purest essence (literally the 5th or highest essence)
precious crystal casting rainbows (also transl. |iris stone|)
reasoning level of the mind; reasoning ability; highest level of the conscious mind
goodness on the rational level of the mind
person who has developed to the rational level
truth on the rational level of the mind
good qualities received on the rational level of the mind

read.archaic_usage: Unclear why flagged - seems normal usage

definitions: things that have a spiritual (not a physical) reality
the process of being saved; being "bought back" from being slaves to evil
regenerated people; people who have been spiritually reborn
lifelong process of being spiritually reborn
the strongest love in a person that dominates his life; the dominant love (usually transl. |the ruling love|)
external or superstitious belief system; some sort of religion
loves and thoughts that are deeply impressed on the inner part of a person and "remain" with him (the most significant of these are acquired in infancy, also transl. |remnants|)
deep affectional impressions that stay with a person
deep intellectual impressions that stay with a person
things or people that represent something spiritual
church that has rituals and buildings that represent heavenly things
the Israelitish and Jewish churches with their representative laws, rituals and buildings
meaning of Scriptures as they describe the spiritual development of the church
raise from death into spiritual life
strongest love in a person that dominates his life; the dominant love (also transl. |reigning love|)
second stomach of animals that chew their cud
age of Saturn (another expression for the |golden age|)
mythological lecherous beast living in the woods - half goat, panther or wolf and half human
knowledge of what things represent spiritually
knowledges; facts; data (especially derived from the experience of nature or the study of the Scriptures, also transl. |knowledges| and |memory-knowledges|)
truths from the study of nature
truths from the study of the Scriptures
branches cut off to be grafted on to another tree
waste matter left over after refining metal; slag
adulterous behavior (called |harlotry| in the Bible; also transl. |whoredom|)
love of adultery; love that is completely opposite to marriage love; love that does not regard adultery as a sin
marriage in which the partners feel free to commit adultery
middle of the three heavens (also called |the spiritual heaven|)
sense; experience with the five senses
literal meaning of Scriptures (also referred to as |the letter|; |the letter of the word| and |the literal sense|)
sense organ (each of the five senses is a "sensory")
person who thinks from the evidence of the senses; the part of a person that has physical sensations
watery fluid in the body; secreted serum
"the sex" refers to the other sex; the opposite sex
spiritual meaning of some natural symbol which also corresponds to it
things that have a meaning; things that carry a spiritual meaning
mean (also transl. |denote|, |mean| - note: words, things and actions "signify")
single; plain; not mixed; uncomplicated; open
people who are straightforward and honest
putting on the appearance of love in marriage
existing at the same time or on the same level
orderly arrangement of things on the same plane (for example the arrangement of rooms on the same floor of a building)
details; most minute particulars; single parts (also transl. |several parts|, used in contrast to |universals|)
discharging through the nose; blowing the nose
group; community (the communities of heaven, large and small, are called "societies")
person who believes in the ideas of Socinus, who denied the divinity of Christ
ceremonial; customary; done on a regular basis
inmost part of a person; spirit; essence
person who has died and is now in the spiritual world, specifically in the World of Spirits
the mind including feelings, thoughts, memory, etc.
person who lives on the basis of truth
belonging to the spirit (with special emphasis on the quality of truth in contrast to the "celestial" which is a quality of goodness and love)
not natural; not external; higher level than the natural
heavenly qualities of love touched by enlightened understanding; intermediate between the celestial and spiritual heavens
church that mainly emphasizes truth and charity toward the neighbor
spiritual disposition; inclination to love truth
charity; the good of loving the neighbor based on the truth; the goodness of living according to the truth
middle of the three heavens (also called the |second heaven|)
a philosophic term that expresses the idea that spiritual things flow into natural ones and not the other way around, also called |occasional influx| and |opportune inflow|
the part of heaven that is ruled by a love of truth and love toward the neighbor
love of the spirit; charity; mutual love based on a love of truth
person whose life is based on the truth; person who lives from higher principles than merely natural ones
the intellectual part of a person

part of the lowest heaven (which includes angels who are spiritual-natural, and those who are celestial-natural. The spiritual-natural are more intellectual and the celestial-natural more affectional)
spiritual meaning of Scriptures; Scriptures as understood in the spiritual heaven (also called |the internal sense|)
intellectual things; things of faith and charity
truth about spiritual things; truth that comes from a spirit of goodness
world where people live after death, including the three main divisions: heaven, hell and the world of spirits
inner world of people still living on earth
vital; lively; full of spirit; volatile
false conscience; inappropriate conscience; conscience about things that do not really matter
things that stabilize and make firm
condition; stage of development; frame of mind
constant times; fixed intervals of time
extremely loud (from "Stentor", a Greek warrior with a notoriously loud voice)
log; stem; trunk of a tree
love for helpless infants, especially the love felt for them by their parents (also transl. |parental love|, |parental affection|)
mythological river in the underworld that people had to cross after death
seduction; taking away virginity (also transl. |debauchery|, and |deflowering|)
world below heaven; the world of spirits (also transl. |sub-heavenly earth|)
a being capable of receiving, thinking and feeling; recipient
spirit sent out as a messenger (also called |emissary spirit|)
elevate; raise to a higher level
this world; the world under the moon
follow one after another (not used to mean "the opposite of fail")
following in a sequence step by step from the highest to the lowest
orderly sequence from top to bottom (in a building the different floors follow in "successive order", while the different rooms on the same floor are in "simultaneous order")
things that follow in a sequence
magnifying glass used to start fires (also transl. |burning glass|)
someone who believes that God decided before creation who would go to heaven and who to hell
deepest meaning of the Scriptures (also called |the inmost sense|)
form of reasoning drawing conclusions from two premises
person who joins together two different points of view or two different groups of people
union of two different religious groups
silence; reticence; not saying anything at all
in mythology the sunless region below Hades where Zeus put the Titans
the vast empire of the Tartars that extended over eastern Europe and Asia, including Mongolia and China (The eastern and largest portion of Tartary was called |great tartary|)
try; test; attack (not used to mean "allure")
trial; test; attack; combat (not used to mean "allurement")
come to a boundary; come to completion; reach a limit
the world as consisting of land and water
highest of the three heavens (also called |the celestial heaven|)
the part of the earth around the equator
transfer; convey from one person to another or from one place to another
transfer from one person to another or from one place to another
transformation, as when Jesus appeared to His disciples in another form (Matthew 17:1-13)
transference; being carried from one place to another, or from one world to another
being conveyed from one language to another
passing from one world to another; moving from one place to another; migration
change into something else; convert into another substance
changing from one substance to another; the Roman Catholic teaching that the bread of the communion is changed into the actual body of Christ
government with three people in charge
grind; thresh; crush with a mortar and pestle
truth that comes from qualities of goodness (also called |the spiritual of the celestial|)
true idea that is part of a person's faith
wild beasts or birds of the desert (Isaiah 34:14)
idol or god that was believed to care for a city, place, or person
somewhere or other (used together with the Greek word |pu| to indicate "some undefined place")
last in sequence; the lowest; the most external; final; the most remote (also transl. |outmost|; not used to mean "the greatest")
physical body - especially the arms, hands, legs and feet
of one heart; of one mind
intellect; ability to understand (also transl. |the intellectual| and |discernment|)
rising and falling; moving as if in waves
covering all things; whole; existing everywhere; entering into all things; general
universal points; general principles (in contrast to |singulars|)
the Lord's church existing everywhere and transcending church organizations
language known everywhere and by everybody such as language in heaven)
existing in all things; existing everywhere
wine that is flat and has lost its flavor
able to be bought for a price; corrupt
tiny sac; very small air sac in the lungs
one of the virgins dedicated to keeping the sacred fire of the of the goddess, Vesta
deputy; person who acts for someone else
ability to love, desire and intend (usually transl. |the will|; also transl. |intentionality|)
promiscuous person; person with loose morals
ability to love, feel, desire and intend (also transl. |voluntary| and |intentionality|)
the Scriptures as the inspired Word of God
the world between heaven and hell where people go afterdeath before going to the one or the other
wild beasts or birds of the desert (Isaiah 34:14)
